item.title: Daniel add a quote by David Dodge
item.description: "The professed object of war generally is to preserve liberty and produce a lasting peace: but war never did and never will preserve liberty and produce a lasting peace, for it is a divine decree that all nations who take the sword shall perish with the sword. War is no more adapted to preserve liberty and produce a lasting peace than midnight darkness is to produce noonday light." -- David Dodge

item.title: Daniel add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "If the force of arms is considered the only means of authority, it is not an auspicious instrument." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Daniel add a quote by Albert Pike
item.description: "What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us; what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal." -- Albert Pike

item.title: Daniel add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Daniel add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Daniel add a quote by Robert E. Lee
item.description: "It is well that war is so terrible, or we should grow too fond of it." -- Robert E. Lee

item.title: Daniel add a quote by Charles Caleb Colton
item.description: "We hate some persons because we do not know them; and we will not know them because we hate them." -- Charles Caleb Colton
